comment.author: 31575009@N05
comment._content: This image is also used as the background on our War Cabinet Twitter page www.twitter.com/ukwarcabinet where you can follow the progress of the Second World War in 1940, day by day.

comment.author: 82096028@N00
comment._content: Do you think it possible that this is actually by W K Rogman: www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/a2a/records.aspx?cat=159-wwp&... University Library, Department of Manuscripts and Special Collections#5-2-16

comment.author: 31575009@N05
comment._content: We don't know. We genuinely don't know anything about (K)rogman. If you do, please add the information to our Your Archives wiki: yourarchives.nationalarchives.gov.uk/index.php?title=Krog... We're currently running a project to collect more information on the war art and artists in our collections.

comment.author: 50802455@N04
comment._content:
Yes this is definitely by W.Krogman not W K Rogman. He was a war artist that supplied work to a company based in Cambridge Circus, London during the war who were called War Artists and Illustrators.
My father also worked for them and used deliver artwork to a section of the Ministry of Information who,at the time, were based at Senate House, London. Many of the artwoks were bought for PR and Morale purposes, many of them were not bought and were then discarded by War Artists and Illustrators. Luckily my father managed to salvage a few original artworks and I now have several by W.Krogman and also an artist called R.W. Jobson later to work on three British Comic Book Annuals incorporating the character Captain Space Kingley. Hope that helps.
